Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 08:35AM Qball11 wrote: Hi folks.  I am about 10 days out from my first round of TC.  Very similar to everyone else in terms of side effects.  Thanks so much for the tips on ice water during chemo for mouth sores (have them, ouch) and claritin for bone pain.  Also interested to hear that water tastes like cr@p to others.  I am an avid hydrator normally and like water but since chemo started if always tastes "off" to me.  I am otherwise doing really well all things considered.  I played golf and tennis this weekend and am trying to keep up with my regular exercise.  Question: has anyone had problems with their sinuses?  Mine are super dry and are bleeding a little from what I assume is cracking from the dryness.  Being July in Chicago I am constantly in a/c so the dry air is playing a part but I've never had this problem before and its definitely started after chemo.  Any input is appreciated!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 11:44AM Qball11 wrote: Thanks for the vasoline tip.  Also glad to hear that I am not the only one with the sinus issue; my nurse said that there aren't normally any sinus issues and I was thinking that it was unrelated.  Praying that in addition to the head hair that I lose some other body hair.  There's got to be some benefit from this right???!!!!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 02:01PM Qball11 wrote: kl22-Day 4 was my worst day too!  So achy, tired, and mad at everything.  I also was afraid to lose the hair but ultimately just buzzed it.  I cried, but then I grew fond of my little qball head.  I won't take it out in public or anything but its cute in its own little way. chickadee- I am definitely going to mention the sinus stuff to the nurse when I see them next week so that they can be more informed.
